cab.content: CiTtal Work of the Local Government Board for the Week ending 8th June, 1917. .1. Progress has "been made with the Committee Stage of the Representation of the People Bill and with the work of the Boundary Commission. 2. The Housing Conference has held a further meeting and reached some important conclusions which are about to he submitted to the' War Cabinet. 3. Circulars have been prepared to Local Authorities in connection with the Naval and Military War Pensions (Administrative Expenses) Act, 1917, and as to Financial Arrangements in regard to schemes for the prevention and treatment of venereal dises.se. 4. Among other matters which have been under con- sideration may be mentioned arrangements for controlling the distribution of coal in the coming winter involving the co-operation of local authorities, and the provision of material for the repair of important roads.f Government Board, Whitehall, S.W.1, June, 1917.
